revised_title: A Detailed Account of a Remarkable Meteor and Aurora Borealis Observed in Oxford
tldr: The author, John Swinton, describes a remarkable meteor and Aurora Borealis observed in Oxford on October 24, 1769. The meteor expanded and turned deep blood-red, while the Aurora Borealis filled the sky with pale yellow streamers. A beautiful purple-colored arch also appeared, making the phenomenon even more extraordinary.
